cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 170 mi WSW of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Presently moving west in the southeast Gulf of Mexico; forecast to turn northwest, then north and finally northeast, crossing the Florida Big Bend and then tracking along/off the Southeast U.S. Atlantic coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast (near Cedar Key area)

port.name: Port of Palm Beach District, FL

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeastern Gulf Coast, Florida Big Bend, and Southeast U.S. Atlantic coast from Georgia through the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions with occasional tropical‐storm-force gusts (25–35 mph) possible Wednesday night into Thursday
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the southeast Florida coast
weather_observation.rainfall: Total accumulations of 3–5 inches with isolated higher amounts could cause localized ponding and minor flooding around the port
weather_observation.other_hazards: Periods of lightning and reduced visibility in heavy squalls could disrupt cargo and passenger operations
